Thank you for the clarification. Here is an updated response for Question (d):

(d) Recommend which of Option 1 and Option 2 SV should consider in order to increase sales.

Point: SV should consider implementing both Option 1 and Option 2 to increase sales.

Application: Option 1, opening a B2C e-commerce store, would allow SV to sell directly to customers outside of its local winery, expanding its reach beyond its current customer base. This would increase convenience for customers who are unable to visit the winery in person, and also provide SV with valuable customer data that can be used to improve its marketing efforts. Option 2, selling SV wines to wholesalers serving the whole of the US market for premium wines, would allow SV to access a wider customer base and increase its brand exposure. This would also provide a more stable revenue stream compared to the uncertainty of direct-to-consumer sales.

Detailed Analysis: While both options have their advantages, it would be best for SV to implement both in order to maximize its potential sales. By opening a B2C e-commerce store, SV can sell directly to customers outside of its local winery, which can help it to expand its reach and customer base. At the same time, selling SV wines to wholesalers serving the whole of the US market for premium wines would provide SV with a more stable revenue stream and increase its brand exposure. By utilizing both options, SV can take advantage of the benefits of each, while also mitigating the potential risks associated with relying too heavily on one distribution channel.

Furthermore, by selling directly to consumers through an e-commerce platform, SV can gain valuable customer data and insights that can be used to improve its marketing efforts and tailor its products to customer preferences. This can help to differentiate SV from its competitors and provide a competitive advantage. Additionally, by selling to wholesalers, SV can take advantage of economies of scale and potentially reduce its production costs, which can help to improve its profit margins.

Overall, by implementing both Option 1 and Option 2, SV can increase its sales and expand its customer base, while also mitigating the potential risks associated with relying too heavily on one distribution channel.
